column1: Al-Kiswah  (Arabic: الكسوة‎ Al Kiswah also spelled Kissoué/Kiswe) is a city in the Rif Dimashq Governorate
column2: Syria. It is located approximately 13 kilometres (8 miles) south of Damascus. It was the location of the 1303 Battle of Marj al-Saffar
column3: and the childhood home of Adnan Awad.

column2: Al-Kiswah belongs to Markaz Rif Dimashq district. It is one of the largest towns of the district by terms of population.
Eli Smith noted it as a predominantly Sunni Muslim village.
